frontend_storyDescription.message: Talkie blev udviklet et par dage fÃ¸r nytÃ¥r 2016/2017, pÃ¥ en udfordring fra en ven. Udfordringen startede med spÃ¸rgsmÃ¥let: mens pendling til arbejde, er det muligt at lytte til en artikel i stedet for at lÃ¦se det? Let, sagde jeg, og satte sig for at bevise det â€” eller i hvert fald at gÃ¸re min browser tale tekst ved hjÃ¦lp af en dum computer stemme. Den grundlÃ¦ggende version, uden nogen brugergrÃ¦nseflade, viste sig at vÃ¦re trivielt at skabe. TilfÃ¸jelse af en brugergrÃ¦nseflade, tog lidt lÃ¦ngere tid. TilfÃ¸jelse ordentlig sprog detektering en flok mere kode. At overvinde fejl i browseren endnu mere arbejde. Listen over forbedringer og funktioner fortsÃ¦tter â€” og et par tusinde linjer kode senere, er du kigger pÃ¥ det endelige resultat.
frontend_storyDescription.original: Talkie was developed a few days before the New Year 2016/2017, on a challenge from a friend. The challenge started with the question: while commuting to work, is it possible to listen to an article instead of reading it? Easy, I said, and set out to prove it â€” or at least to make my browser speak out text using a silly computer voice. The basic version, without any user interface, turned out to be trivial to create. Adding a user interface, took a bit longer. Adding proper language detection a bunch more code. Overcoming bugs in the browser even more work. The list of improvements and features goes on â€” and a few thousand lines of code later, you're looking at the end result.

notAbleToSpeakTextFromThisSpecialTab.original: Talkie cannot access the selected text from this type of page. It is a very special page, and there are security limitations put in by the browser. You can also try to select text, then right click on it, and choose Talkie in the menu. I'm sorry for the inconvenience.
